data.title: Elizabeth Rosemond Taylor (1932-2011)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Elizabeth Taylor born 1932 Hampstead Garden Suburb, London, England, United Kingdom died 2011 Los Angeles, Los Angeles, California, United States including ancestors + children + 4 photos + 4 genealogist comments + questions + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Dame Elizabeth Rosemond "Liz" Taylor

Born 27 Feb 1932 in Hampstead Garden Suburb, London, England, United Kingdom

Ancestors

Sister of Howard Francis Taylor

Wife of Conrad Nicholson Hilton Jr. — married 6 May 1950 (to 1951) in Los Angeles, Los Angeles, California, United States

Wife of Michael Charles Gauntlett Wilding — married 1952 (to 1957) in Westminster, Middlesex, England, United Kingdom

Wife of Avrom Hirsch (Goldbogen) Todd — married 1957 (to 1958) [location unknown]

Wife of Edwin Jack (Tisch) Fisher — married 12 May 1959 (to 1964) in Nevada, USA

Wife of Richard Walter (Jenkins) Burton — married 15 Mar 1964 (to 1974) in Montreal, Quebec, Canada

Wife of John William Warner III — married 4 Dec 1976 (to Nov 1982) in Richmond, Virginia, United States

Wife of Lawrence Lee Fortensky — married 6 Oct 1991 (to 31 Oct 1996) [location unknown]

Mother of [private son (1950s - unknown)], [private son (1950s - unknown)] and [private daughter (1950s - unknown)]

Died 23 Mar 2011 at age 79 in Los Angeles, Los Angeles, California, United States

Profile last modified 3 Jun 2024 | Created 27 Aug 2014

This page has been accessed 14,500 times.

Biography

Elizabeth Taylor is Notable.

"Dame Elizabeth Rosemond Taylor DBE (February 27, 1932 – March 23, 2011) was a British-American actress, businesswoman, and humanitarian.

She began her career as a child actress in the early 1940s, and was one of the most popular stars of classical Hollywood cinema in the 1950s. She continued her career successfully into the 1960s, and remained a well-known public figure for the rest of her life. In 1999, the American Film Institute named her the seventh-greatest female screen legend".[1]

1932 Feb 27 Born[2][3] in Hampstead Garden Suburb, London, England, UK

1950 May 6 marriage to Conrad Hilton[4]

2011 Mar 23 passed away in Los Angeles, California[5]
